newsitem.title: FRANCE: Arthuis says French government needs new mandate.
newsitem.headline: Arthuis says French government needs new mandate.

text.p: French Finance Minister Jean Arthuis said on Monday that the centre-right government needs a new five-year mandate to clean up the country's finances.
"We need five more years to pursue and enlarge the structural reforms of the state and French society and to clean up public finances to be competitive," Arthuis told Europe 1 radio.
Arthuis said that to dispel all uncertainty blocking economic growth, it would be better to speed up the elections.

"To have jobs, we need growth. Certainly, the situation is improving," he said. "But what we need now is investment and we know that people don't invest ahead of elections. So if we want this key factor behind growth and jobs to meet our expections, it would be better to accelerate the electoral calendar."
Conservative President Jacques Chirac is widely expected to announce an early general election late on Monday to clear the decks in the drive for a single European currency.
Arthuis said the previous Socialist administration had left a "calamitous record" and "we want to offer other possibilities to our children".
Opinion polls suggest a tight battle in any election.
